snippet: Young, wealthy and gay, Chris Hughes and Sean Eldridge have begun to emerge as major players on the national political stage.
abstract: Profiles of gay power couple Chris Hughes and Sean Eldridge of Garrision, NY, who have emerged as a significant force in national progressive political circles, particularly those fighting for gay rights; Hughes, Facebook co-founder and the current owner/editor in chief of The New Republic, and Eldridge, investor and political activist, plan to marry in June. Photos (L)
lead_paragraph: ''Are you twelve?'' A plump middle-aged woman in a flower-print dress was standing in front of Chris Hughes at The Paris Review's spring gala at Cipriani 42nd Street on April 3, mocking his youth. Mr. Hughes, a founder of Facebook who bought a majority stake in The New Republic the previous month and then appointed himself publisher and editor in chief, had earlier given a toast in which he joked about buying a copy of the Review in college because he thought it was about Paris.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: SAME-SEX MARRIAGE, CIVIL UNIONS AND DOMESTIC PARTNERSHIPS
